alternatives.transcript: ESPN the world leader in Motor Sports coverage presents Speed World the best is Indianapolis Motor Speedway we're happy with Marlboro car and we're at work I tell you the weather conditions are AJ had a heck of a run we really did a tremendous job many who come here are intimidated by the history the Grandeur mostly by the speed psychologically they are beaten before they begin but through 15 highly productive years here Rick has kept

the Big Show in perspective I've always just trying to treat it as another race in another track and that's that's the Outlook I've always had on it and going into it the product main reason just so you don't let the pressure get to you you may wonder why you're not seeing Rick Mears I heard a day behind me they are working with the Marlborough sponsored carve Emerson fittipaldi Roger Penske Rick Rhino and all the crew are here

ABC Sports presents the 75th running of the Indianapolis 500 mile race the Penske team always at the Leading Edge of race technology uses an on-board computer Telemetry system to reveal crucial details about how the car is running

the most important data deals with fuel consumption we won races because we knew exactly what we had to do the standpoint of fuel economy you get on the Leading Edge of Technology you're trying new things you've got to have the ability to monitor that and Telemetry is the basis of that and I think it's very important unique to the Penske team the car's onboard computer relays data to the pits computer during the race this information helps the engineers determined precise values of fuel consumption
and takes the guesswork out of predicting refueling pit stops
welcome to the home show

years ago women were not allowed to be in the pit area we're not allowed to be anywhere near the track now I understand that you actually work on the pit Crews this is truth yes it is and just like I said earlier it's just so much better for us because it keeps us involved it keeps us focused on the timing and scoring and we don't have time to think about anything else

Good morning America I'm Charles Gibson and I'm Joe London Stewart coming up now at 21 before the our auto racing history was made in Indianapolis yesterday hope you saw it when Rick Mears won his fourth Indy 500 he became only the third man to do so joining the legends of the speedway Allen's are senior and a.j. foyt and he won in a field crowded with past champions but is the winning car owner Roger Penske said about mirrors Rick was just working in his office yesterday and he's joining us from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway this morning as well

his wife Chris who also happens to be a member of the winning pit crew and I thank you both for being here congratulations Rick it was great to watch thank you very much Charlie fascinating moment we have the tape you can't see it I know but fascinating moment 13 laps to go yesterday coming out of turn one and Michael Andretti passes you in a place that I don't think anyone including you expected him to pass did you know right well I knew that lane was open that's the one I left open I ran low so if he was going to get by me had to take the long way around and you know Mike

girls a tremendous race car driver and if there's a lane open he'll take it wherever it's at but coming into that short Chute is an awfully tough play a place to pass and yet you turned around a lap later and passed him now I had you plotted that as you thought in your mind as you went around that 44 seconds that lap we'll all get him where he got me no not really we kind of took it as it came you know we're able to pick up his draft and when we got down there to the corner he stayed load like just as I did the lap before and by him staying low that left the outside Lane open that was only choice I had

and I felt you know we had a run so we had to we had to make it thinner or maybe never you know you didn't know the tires were still cool so I just took that shot Rick did you think at that point you had the faster car because it seemed watching it as I was that Michael's car was running a little faster at that time and yet you blew by him and just pulled away for the rest of the race well we've been saving a little bit and you know all day long we've been working with the car my normal program you know we were spent the first half making the car as good as we could get it and then we ran tall six gear kept the RPMs down

save fuel which allowed us to not make that last stop that Michael had to and that was one of the things that really helped us out just being conservative a little bit until the end well that's the exact strategy you were here talking about on Friday morning Chris let me ask you about what Rick just raised and that is that fuel question you got by he got by on one fewer pit stops I think Andretti was in the pit 11 seconds longer than Rick was and since he only one Rick only one by three seconds that obviously is very key how much fuel was in his car at the end how

close wasn't it was pretty close I'm not sure of the exact amount but I'll tell you what that's the thing that went through my mind more than anything I knew that Rick obviously in his car was capable of winning but I was really concerned about the fuel and we're just we're really thankful that that we did have enough was there a concern in the pits that he might run out of gas yeah they're they're really was I don't think necessarily the last couple of laps

but in the beginning right after right after his last Pit Stop they were trying to do a lot of calculations to find out just how much fuel they did get in the Marlboro car you looked as cool as Rick says he is in the pits where you really know this was my far the most nerve-wracking race I've ever been through and I'm glad it's over Rick I heard you say it gets better each time does it yes it does it really does I you know I never like I said I never dreamed of being here originally but let alone to win this race and

and now the fourth time just incredible if it gets better each time but the seventh or eighth them you're going to be getting static I can't imagine what that would be like him so you'll be back for number five next year obviously yes we will be back with the with the Marvel team and you know hopefully we'd like to try to get another one
